questions:
Q1: What is the name of the film directed by Jean Yarbrough in 1962?
A1: Saintly Sinners

Q2: Who stars in the film as Father Dan Sheridan?
A2: Don Beddoe

Q3: What happens to the car belonging to the protagonist after it is repossessed?
A3: It is sold to a kindly Rev. Daniel Sheridan, who sets out on a fishing trip.

Q4: Who plays the role of Slim in the film?
A4: Stanley Clements

Q5: What is the name of the actress who plays the role of Sue Braeden in the film?
A5: Jacklyn O'Donnell (as Erin O'Donnell)

Q6: Who plays the role of Police Chief Harrihan in the film?
A6: Willis Bouchey

Q7: Can you name any of the other actors in the film's cast?
A7: Yes, Addison Richards as Monsignor Craig, Ron Hagerthy as Joe Breaden, Clancy Cooper as Idaho Murphy, William Fawcett as Horsefly Brown, Earle Hodgins as Uncle Clete, and Norman Leavitt as Pittheus (as Norm Leavitt).

Q8: What is the film's release date?
A8: 1962

Q9: Can you list any of the film's crew members?
A9: Yes, Jean Yarbrough (director), Don Beddoe (producer), and William Fawcett (writer).

Q10: Is there a list of films released in 1962 that includes Saintly Sinners?
A10: Yes, see List of American films of 1962.

Q1: What is Ohimai Amaize's profession?
A1: Ohimai Amaize is a journalist with a multi-sectoral background that spans anti-corruption, youth advocacy, civil society, political campaigns, brand development, communications strategy, and governance.

Q2: What were some of the notable achievements of Ohimai Amaize?
A2: Some of the notable achievements of Ohimai Amaize include being the youngest presidential campaign manager in modern democratic history, founding The Signal newspaper, and authoring the book "Fighting Lions: The Untold Story of Dele Momodu's Presidential Campaign."

Q3: What is the name of the popular daily breakfast television program that Ohimai Amaize joined in 2018?
A3: The popular daily breakfast television program that Ohimai Amaize joined in 2018 is called "Kakaaki."

Q4: How did Ohimai Amaize become involved in politics?
A4: Ohimai Amaize became involved in politics in August 2010 when he was appointed as the youngest presidential campaign manager (26) in modern democratic history by popular journalist Dele Momodu. He later served as Special Advisor on Advocacy to Mallam Bolaji Abdullahi, Nigeria's Minister of Youth Development, and Special Advisor on Media Strategy to Senator Musiliu Obanikoro, as Minister of State for Defence and later for Foreign Affairs until May 29, 2015.

Q5: What is the name of the book authored by Ohimai Amaize?
A5: The book authored by Ohimai Amaize is called "Fighting Lions: The Untold Story of Dele Momodu's Presidential Campaign."

Q1: What is Allan Dwan's date of birth?
A1: April 3, 1885.

Q2: Where was Allan Dwan born?
A2: Toronto, Ontario, Canada.

Q3: What was the name of Dwan's elder brother?
A3: Leo Garnet Dwan (1883-1964).

Q4: What was the name of the company that Dwan worked for in Chicago?
A4: A lighting company.

Q5: When did Dwan start his directing career?
A5: By accident in 1911, when he was sent to California to locate a company that had vanished.

Q6: What was the name of the first motion picture studio in California history?
A6: Flying A Studios.

Q7: Who did Dwan direct in several successful movies?
A7: Fellow Canadian-American Mary Pickford, as well as her husband Douglas Fairbanks, and child-star Shirley Temple.

Q8: How many motion pictures did Dwan direct over a long career spanning almost 50 years?
A8: 125.

Q9: What was the name of the documentary series that interviewed Dwan in 1980?
A9: Hollywood.

Q10: Where is Allan Dwan interred?
A10: San Fernando Mission Cemetery, Mission Hills, California.

Q1: What is the name of the movie?
A1: Mr. Fix-It

Q2: Who are the main actors in the movie?
A2: Douglas Fairbanks, Marjorie Daw, and Wanda Hawley

Q3: Who directed the movie?
A3: Allan Dwan

Q4: What is the plot of the movie?
A4: A man becomes known as "Mr. Fix-It" due to his ability to fix things and enters the aristocratic home of a family as their nephew, where he wins the heart of one of the daughters and sets aright the affairs of the other daughters and the uncle.

Q5: What was the movie's reception?
A5: Like many American films of the time, Mr. Fix-It was subject to restrictions and cuts by city and state film censorship boards.

Q6: Is the movie preserved?
A6: Yes, a restored print of the film was presented at the San Francisco Silent Film Festival in 2011.

Q7: What is the list of rediscovered films?
A7: Mr. Fix-It is listed as one of the rediscovered films.
